summary: This document appears to be a medical or administrative note regarding medication distribution to an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It records that on July 26, 2019, a psychologist noted a change in the quantity of Colace and milk of magnesia being provided to an inmate from 30 days' worth to 15 days' worth.

persons.name: Psy.D. Chief Psychologist
persons.role: Chief Psychologist at Metropolitan Correctional Center
persons.context: The psychologist who made the note about medication distribution to an inmate on July 26, 2019.

events.title: Medication distribution change noted
events.description: A psychologist noted that an inmate was being given 15 days worth of Colace and half a bottle of milk of magnesia for self-carry, instead of the previously planned 30 days worth and a full bottle.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center
locations.address: 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
locations.context: Federal detention facility where the medication distribution was recorded.

keyFacts: The document is dated July 26, 2019, which is during Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
It records a change in medication distribution from 30 days' worth to 15 days' worth of Colace and milk of magnesia for an inmate.
The document is marked as CONFIDENTIAL and appears to be part of the Southern District of New York (SDNY) case files.
